validation_rules: question must not be answerable without seeing the image

question.name: Question Pipeline
question.description: Recognizing the main object or concept depicted in the image
question_constraints: Questions must target the concept, property, or process conveyed by the image, not only object recognition
If external knowledge is needed to identify the correct answer, a concise guiding hint must be provided
Fill-in-the-blank questions should provide sufficient guidance so the concept can be inferred
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
question.example_template: Which term best matches the picture?

object_intra_class_instance_positioning.name: Object Intra-Class Instance Positioning Pipeline
object_intra_class_instance_positioning.description: Identifying the spatial location of a specific instance within a group of same-class objects by using distinctive features and relative positional relationships
question_constraints: the image must contain multiple instances of the same object class
the question must explicitly indicate that multiple same-class objects exist in the image
the question must explicitly mention one or more distinctive feature(s) that uniquely identify the target instance among the same-class objects
the question must require reasoning about the target object's position relative to other instances of the same class (e.g., ordering, comparison, or relative placement)
the question must ask for the spatial location of the target object
the question must instruct the respondent to answer based solely on visual evidence from the image
the question must avoid using object indices or labels that are not visually inferable from the image
example_templates: Where is the [object type] with [distinctive feature] located relative to the other [object type]s in the image?
Among the [object type]s shown, where is the one with [distinctive feature] positioned in the image?
Considering all the [object type]s in the image, where is the [one] that has [distinctive feature] located?

visual_recognition.name: Main Object Identification Pipeline
visual_recognition.description: Recognize the main object depicted in the image without explicitly revealing it in the question text.
question_constraints: Questions must ask about the main object in the image without including its name or synonyms in the question itself
Questions should encourage reasoning from visual features, context, or function rather than directly stating the object
If external knowledge is necessary to infer the correct answer, a brief, neutral hint may be included without revealing the object
Questions must instruct the respondent to answer based solely on the image
Avoid leading questions or providing cues that make the answer trivial
visual_recognition.example_template: Which object appears as the primary focus in the picture?

caption.name: Caption Pipeline
caption.description: Identifying the correct overall caption for an image
question_constraints: question must ask the overall scene
no object-level localization or counting
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
caption.example_template: Which one is the correct caption of this image?

place_recognition.name: Place Recognition Pipeline
place_recognition.description: Identifying a place or landmark shown in the image
question_constraints: Questions must focus only on the visually salient or highlighted region of the image
Questions should specifically ask for the real-world place name depicted in that region
External or historical knowledge may be used to identify the place name if necessary
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
place_recognition.example_template: What is the name of the place shown?

text_association.name: Text Association Pipeline
text_association.description: Associating an image with appropriate short text
question_constraints: associated text must be image-grounded
no fictional storytelling
text should be realistic and concise
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
text_association.example_template: Which text could be associated with this image if it were posted on social media?

object_proportion.name: Object Proportion Pipeline
object_proportion.description: Estimating the proportion of the image occupied by a selected object

constraints: object occupies a non-trivial portion of the image

question_constraints: question must focus on relative size or proportion in the image
question must explicitly mention the selected object or category
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
object_proportion.example_template: Approximately what proportion of the picture is occupied by [object]?

object_position.name: Object Position Pipeline
object_position.description: Identifying the spatial location of a selected object within the image

constraints: object has a stable spatial extent
object is not trivial or purely background

question_constraints: question must explicitly mention the selected object
no object counting or attribute reasoning
question must ask target object position
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
object_position.example_template: Where is the [object] located in the picture?

object_relative_position.name: Object Relative Position Pipeline
object_relative_position.description: Identifying the relative position of a selected object within the image

constraints: object has a stable spatial extent
object is not trivial or purely background
object and other_object must be spatially distinct and have a meaningful relative position relationship

question_constraints: question must explicitly mention the selected object and the other object
no object counting or attribute reasoning
question must ask target object relative position
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
object_relative_position.example_template: Where is the [object] located relative to the [other_object] in the picture?

object_absence.name: Object Absence Pipeline
object_absence.description: Identifying regions where a selected object is absent

constraints: object appears in some regions and is absent in others

question_constraints: question must focus on absence, not presence
if the question is a fill-in-the-blank type, the question must roughly describe the expected answer format, e.g., how to indicate positions in the image or how many regions are involved
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image

object_orientation.name: Object Orientation Pipeline
object_orientation.description: Determining the facing or orientation of a selected object

constraints: object has a clear front-back or directional cue

question_constraints: The question must ask exclusively about the facing direction of the target object, and must explicitly specify the reference frame used for direction judgment (either the image/frame coordinate system or the object-centric coordinate system)
The question must instruct the respondent to answer based on the image
object_orientation.example_template: In the picture, which direction is the [object] facing?

object_counting.name: Object Counting Pipeline
object_counting.description: Counting instances of a selected object in the image
question_constraints: question must ask for a numeric count
no estimation or comparison
object_counting.example_template: How many [objects] are in the picture?
